description: A self-contained unit that occupies only part of a building, available for residential purposes.
A dwelling that stands independently on its own land offering privacy and space.
An upscale and luxurious property, often in a picturesque or exclusive location.
A small, rustic, and typically wooden shelter in a natural or remote setting.
A charming and cozy dwelling, typically in a rural or semi-rural location.
A large, adaptable open space, often converted for residential use from a commercial or industrial building.
A small, one-room apartment typically consisting of a combined living, sleeping, and cooking space.
A low-built, single-story house, offering a simple and accessible living space.
A tall, narrow, traditional residence, usually multi-story, sharing one or more walls with adjacent properties.
A private residence within a larger building or complex, owned individually while common areas are shared.
